thread.title: UK supports Prince Charles to succeed Queen Elizabeth as Commonwealth head

title: UK supports Prince Charles to succeed Queen Elizabeth as Commonwealth head
text:
April 16, 2018 / 4:44 PM / Updated an hour ago UK supports Prince Charles to succeed Queen Elizabeth as Commonwealth head Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - Britain backs Queen Elizabeth’s son and heir, Prince Charles, to succeed her as head of the Commonwealth network of 53 mostly former British colonies, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday. Britain's Prince Charles gestures during a tree-planting ceremony at Government House in Darwin, Australia April 10, 2018. REUTERS/Phil Noble 
“The UK supports the Prince of Wales as the next head of the Commonwealth. He has been a proud supporter of the Commonwealth for more than four decades and has spoken passionately about the organisation’s unique diversity,” the spokesman told reporters. 
“Succession is a matter for the Commonwealth as a whole to determine.” Reporting by William James, editing by Elizabeth Piper
